headline: Why Delta's So-So Results Are Pushing Airline Stocks Higher Today
summary: Delta Air Lines (NYSE: DAL) kicked off earnings season with a whimper, but the airline's relatively benign outlook was far better than some investors had anticipated.  The results provided a lift to the entire sector, with carriers including Southwest Airlines (NYSE: LUV) up as much as 5.3% at the open.  The stocks gave back some of those gains as the morning continued, but Southwest was still up 2% as of 11 a.m. ET.

headline: Airlines and shippers pounce on oil plunge to lock in prices
summary: (Bloomberg) -- With crude prices plunging below $60 a barrel, consumers who count fuel as their single biggest expense are rushing to lock in supplies. More than 25 million barrels of options contracts on the Brent benchmark traded in structures that protect buyers from price gains this week. The activity reflected consumer hedging that allows airlines, truckers and shipping companies to lock in lower fuel costs, according to people involved in the market. headline: Delta stock pops after earnings beat, 'murky' outlook amid tariff uncertainty
summary: Delta Air Lines delivered a beat on earnings per share while revenues missed analyst expectations as elements from a "slower-growth" Q1 clouded the airline's full-year guidance.

raw.headline: Delta stock pops after earnings beat, 'murky' outlook amid tariff uncertainty
